column2: An old noble man, famed for his knowledge and wisdom, arrives at your court. You spend a long time together in deep conversation, discussing about the essence of power and kingship. At the end of the day, you feel enlightened.
Knowledge is the only real key of power.
There can be no real power without strenght... and fear!
Today an old historian from [Root.Location.GetName] told you an interesting tale about the great Julius Caesar. His political and military exploits are always inspiring...
A pity his diplomacy skill was inferior to mine.
Veni, Vidi, Vici!

An old traveller from the south, famed for his wisdom and knowledge, arrives at your court. You spend a long time together in deep conversation, discussing about the greatest rulers of history. At the end of the day, you feel enlightened.
Diplomacy is the real trade of a great ruler.
Any ruler should be a valorous warrior first!
History is made through information... and manipulation.
This world is driven by gold. Just gold.
Today you decided to go and talk to the farmers and commoners of [Root.Location.GetName]. There is always something to learn from the people...\n...or maybe not, after all?
Probably not. But at least I heard rumours...
The way they store crops for the winter is clever, indeed.
While you are walking across the town square, a beggar latches on to you. He claims to be an old friend of your father, now fallen into poverty and destitution.
Guards! Get rid of this dog!
The world is cruel and unforgiving...
An old noble man descending from an ancient Roman patrician family visits your court. He delights you with tales of ancient Rome, about Cicero and clever patrician intrigues.
I am a better diplomat than Cicero himself.
The tales about patrician intrigues taught me something...
A wise old noble man descending from an ancient Roman patrician family visits your court. He lectures you on the history of the ancient Roman Republic, its administration and political system.
The Republic set a model for administration.
But intrigues brought the Republic down...
An arrogant courtier keeps interrupting you when you speak. You have already warned him about it... twice. But apparently he can not help himself.
Enough! Cut off his tongue and feed it to the dogs!
Well, let him speak... again.
